title: Algebra Basics Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of algebraic concepts

questions.text: What is the value of x if 2x + 5 = 13?
questions.explanation: Subtract 5 from both sides: 2x = 8. Then divide by 2: x = 4

questions.text: Simplify the expression: 3(2x + 4) - 2x
questions.explanation: Distribute: 6x + 12 - 2x = 4x + 12. Wait, that's option 0. Let me recalculate: 3(2x + 4) - 2x = 6x + 12 - 2x = 4x + 12

questions.text: Solve: x - 7 = 3
questions.explanation: Add 7 to both sides: x = 3 + 7 = 10

questions.text: What is 5² + 3?
If a = 2 and b = 3, find ab + 5

title: Quadratic Equations Quiz
description: Test your understanding of quadratic equations

questions.text: Solve: x² - 5x + 6 = 0
questions.explanation: Factor: (x - 2)(x - 3) = 0. So x = 2 or x = 3

questions.text: What is the discriminant of x² + 4x + 4 = 0?
questions.explanation: Discriminant = b² - 4ac = 16 - 16 = 0

questions.text: Use the quadratic formula to solve: 2x² + 3x - 2 = 0
questions.explanation: Using the quadratic formula with a=2, b=3, c=-2: x = (-3 ± √(9+16))/4 = (-3 ± 5)/4 = 1/2 or -2

questions.text: What is the vertex of y = (x - 2)² + 3?
questions.explanation: In vertex form y = a(x - h)² + k, the vertex is (h, k) = (2, 3)

questions.text: Solve: x² = 16
questions.explanation: Taking the square root of both sides gives x = ±4 (both 4 and -4)

questions.text: What is sin(30°)?
What is cos(0°)?
In a right triangle, if sin(θ) = 3/5, what is cos(θ)?
questions.explanation: Using the Pythagorean identity: sin²(θ) + cos²(θ) = 1. So cos²(θ) = 1 - 9/25 = 16/25, thus cos(θ) = 4/5

questions.text: What is tan(45°)?
In which quadrant is sin(θ) > 0 and cos(θ) < 0?
questions.explanation: In Quadrant II, sine is positive (above x-axis) and cosine is negative (left of y-axis)

title: Physics Fundamentals Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of basic physics

questions.text: What is Newton's second law of motion?
questions.explanation: F = ma (Force equals mass times acceleration)

questions.text: What is the SI unit of force?
questions.explanation: The Newton (N) is the SI unit of force

questions.text: If an object has a mass of 10 kg and an acceleration of 2 m/s², what is the force?
What is the formula for kinetic energy?
questions.explanation: Kinetic energy = ½ × mass × velocity²

questions.text: According to Newton's first law, an object at rest will stay at rest unless...
options: It is acted upon by a force
It moves on a frictionless surface
questions.explanation: An object remains at rest or in motion unless acted upon by an external force

title: Chemical Reactions Quiz
description: Test your understanding of chemical reactions

questions.text: In the equation 2H₂ + O₂ → 2H₂O, what are the reactants?
questions.explanation: Reactants are the substances on the left side of the equation that react together

questions.text: What type of reaction is: A + B → AB?
questions.explanation: Synthesis reactions combine two or more reactants to form a single product

questions.text: Which of the following is a combustion reaction?
questions.explanation: A combustion reaction involves a substance reacting with oxygen to produce heat and light

questions.text: What is a catalyst in a chemical reaction?
options: A substance that is consumed in the reaction
A substance that speeds up a reaction without being consumed
A substance that forms a product
questions.explanation: A catalyst speeds up a reaction without being permanently changed or consumed

questions.text: Balance the equation: N₂ + H₂ → NH₃
questions.explanation: The balanced equation is N₂ + 3H₂ → 2NH₃ (showing conservation of atoms)

title: Biology Basics Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of basic biology

questions.text: What is the basic unit of life?
questions.explanation: The cell is the smallest unit of life and the basic unit of all living organisms

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of living things?
questions.explanation: Living things are not in a static state; they are dynamic and constantly changing

questions.text: What is the process by which organisms pass traits to offspring?
questions.explanation: Heredity is the passing of traits from parents to offspring through genes

questions.text: Which organelle is responsible for producing energy in the cell?
questions.explanation: Mitochondria are the powerhouse of the cell, producing ATP through cellular respiration

questions.text: What is homeostasis?
options: The ability to maintain stable internal conditions
questions.explanation: Homeostasis is the maintenance of stable internal conditions despite external changes
